entry.title: About Eugene
entry.content:
Introduction

Figure 1 (Left): Approximation of Eugene visualized. His photographer applied a lot of convolution layers.
Figure 2 (Right): Another approximation of Eugene at his natural habitat.

I am a first-year graduate student at Korea University’s school of Artificial Intelligence in the Robot Intelligence Lab. As a first-year student, my current research interests are relatively broad - I am interested in improving the sample efficiency of Reinforcement Learning techniques or finding representations for learning that are effective for solving robotic tasks across multiple domains.

Before starting my graduate degree, I was a Machine Learning Engineer at LiftIgniter, a YC startup that provides recommendations as a service. At LiftIgniter, I spent most of my time delving into information retrieval, predictive analysis, and machine learning techniques related to recommendation systems, along with general software engineering and web architecture.

Prior to that, I completed BSc in Applied Mathematics and BA in Mathematics at Brown University. You can verify my credential here. Use 15C0-B3DB-E2E3 for CeDiD code and EU for the first two letters of my name.

My life further back is complicated, so I’ll end here since we are running out of space; I was born in the United States, nurtured in Denmark, and raised in South Korea.

Figure 2 (Right): Another approximation of Eugene at his natural habitat. I am a first-year graduate student at Korea University’s school of Artificial Intelligence in the Robot Intelligence Lab. As a first-year student, my current research interests are relatively broad - I am interested in improving the sample efficiency of Reinforcement Learning techniques or finding representations for learning that are effective for solving robotic tasks across multiple domains.
